paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant c.1750G>A; p.Gly584Ser, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Long QT Syndrome (LQTS), prolonged QTc interval

individual_records.evidence_sentence: All three have a somewhat prolonged QTc interval on ECGs taken in the recruitment clinic.
All three have a somewhat prolonged QTc interval on ECGs taken in the recruitment clinic.
All three have a somewhat prolonged QTc interval on ECGs taken in the recruitment clinic.
The two participants identified by haplotype analysis, ID4 and ID5, are shaded in black.
The two participants identified by haplotype analysis, ID4 and ID5, are shaded in black.

functional_data.summary: The c.1750G>A variant in KCNH2 is implicated in Long QT Syndrome due to abnormal inactivation gating.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: The variant occurred once in 500 whole genome sequences from the population.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant has been reported in multiple individuals to segregate with long QT syndrome.
key_quotes: This missense mutation is classified as pathogenic/likely pathogenic in the ClinVar archive of human genetic variants.
It has been reported in multiple individuals to segregate with long QT syndrome (LQTS).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
